pros: Great people working here at SSU. Decent benefits from day one.
cons: Wages are low compared to other Ohio public colleges.

pros: The administration truly cares about the students and the programs on campus.  They are willing and able to help faculty members build programs and grow their departments.  The benefits package is also very strong.
cons: The Union.  Shawnee State University is unionized and the union is only interested in protecting the retirement plans of the aging faculty.  The disparity in raises for elder faculty vs junior faculty causes extremely high rates of turn over.  Talented faculty come to Shawnee for a few years and then move on to better positions.  The union supports this model because it reserves plenty of money for those padding their retirement.  The administration has tried to remove some of the professors who are continually lambasted by the students for their abysmal teaching abilities, and yet the union defends them.  Shawnee State will never become anything more than a second rate school until we uphold the "excellence in teaching" requirement for our professors.

pros:
Somewhat free college credits for you or a dependant
Good pay per hr
Easy job for the most part
cons: Some staff/coworkers/supervisors are toxic, have an attitude, are micro managing.  Lowers moral a lot! Just be more laid back, less by the book, and more easy-going/easy to get along with. Sometimes low teamwork, everyone cares about themselves, coworkers act differently around different employees. Coworkers think everyone is the same and should act the same.  Always adding new job duties with no extra pay. Rare raises.

pros: Shawnee State University is a friendly and collaborative environment. More than once I have asked faculty in other departments for help or input with project both personal and student led and have always received great support. The upper administration is generally supportive of creative and academic works, though there is not much funding for travel. The students are great and for the most part very engaged with their studies.
cons: Being an open enrollment school does attract some students not exactly ready for college.

pros: Free college classes, potential for full time, good co-workers, a lot of overtime, good HR office, vacation and sick time for part timers
cons: Low pay, part time, no communication, poor gear, no advancement, no structure, micro managed, police don't have the proper gear in their vehicles.

pros: Simple job and amazing management. Scheduling was flexible and each employee was allowed 2 free tickets to any show.
cons: No room to grow, not a job that I could stay at after graduating as only students were allowed to fill the positions.
